english: Last evening I was rung up by an old college friend whom I had not heard from for years.

japanese: 昨晩、芝居を見に行けばよかったのだが。
english: I wish I had gone to the theater last night.

japanese: 昨晩、私は大変疲れていました。
english: I was very tired last night.

japanese: 昨晩、私の車が盗まれた。
english: My car was stolen last night.

japanese: 昨晩、私たちは高校時代のことを楽しく語り合った。
english: Last night we enjoyed talking over our high school days.

japanese: 昨晩、再び口論をしたので、今日私達は口をきいていない。
english: We had words again last night, so today we're not speaking.

japanese: 昨晩、近所で火事があった。
english: A fire broke out in my neighborhood last night.

japanese: 昨晩、帰り道でにわか雨に会った。
english: I was caught in a shower on my way home yesterday evening.

japanese: 昨晩、その飛行機はロンドンへ向けて出発した。
english: The airplane took off for London last night.

japanese: 昨晩、１１時の電車に間に合ったかい。
english: Could you get the train at 11 last night?

japanese: 昨年彼は航海で３か月を過ごした。
english: Last year, he spent three months at sea.

japanese: 昨年彼は期末の２科目を落とした。
english: Last year, he failed two of his final examinations.

japanese: 昨年日本の政治に大きな変化があった。
english: Last year saw a big political change in Japan.

japanese: 昨年南極で厳しい寒さを経験した。
english: I experienced intense cold at the South Pole last year.

japanese: 昨年度のコンピューターからの利益は、今年度分よりも１０％近く多かった。
english: Profit on computers for the previous year was nearly ten percent higher than the current year.

japanese: 昨年自転車競技が名古屋で行われた。
english: A bicycle race was held in Nagoya last year.

japanese: 昨年私は少なくとも５０本は映画を見た。
english: Last year, I saw at least fifty films.

japanese: 昨年私の兄は毎日学校に遅刻していました。
english: Last year, my brother was late for school every day.

japanese: 昨年私が合衆国にいた時、日本語を話すチャンスがほとんどなかった。
english: Last year when I was in the United States, I had almost no opportunity to speak Japanese.

japanese: 昨年故郷に帰ったが、村も人もすっかり変わっているのに驚いた。
english: Last year I returned home and was surprised to find both the village and the people completely changed.

japanese: 昨年建てられたその建物はとても大きい。
english: The building built last year is very big.

japanese: 昨年兄は自分の友人と結婚した。
english: My brother married his friend's sister last year.

japanese: 昨年会社が生産調整をしたとき、ジョージは一時解雇された。
english: George was laid off when his company cut back production last year.

japanese: 昨年会ったのを覚えている。
english: I remember seeing you last year.

japanese: 昨年以来からは何の便りもありません。
english: We have not heard from him since last year.

japanese: 昨年ロンドンにいたとき、誰かが私の部屋に侵入して財布を盗んだ。
english: When I was in London last year, someone broke into my room and stole my wallet.

japanese: 昨年より物価の上昇が続いている。
english: Prices have been rising since last year.

japanese: 昨年フィリッピンでは地震や津波のために六千人以上の死者があった。
english: Last year in the Philippines, earthquakes and tidal waves resulted in the deaths of more than 6000 people.

japanese: 昨年は有り余る程の米が生産された。
english: An abundance of rice was produced last year.

japanese: 昨年は輸入が輸出を超えた。
english: Imports exceeded exports last year.

japanese: 昨年は輸出が好調の反面、輸入が落ち着いていたので貿易収支は改善した。
english: The nation's trade balance improved last year as exports were strong, while imports remained steady.

japanese: 昨年は赤字でした。
english: We went into the red last year.

japanese: 昨年は雪が多かった。
english: We had plenty of snow last year.

japanese: 昨年は死者数より出生数が多かった。
english: Last year, there were more births than deaths.

japanese: 昨年は殺人事件が多かった。
english: There were a lot of murders last year.

japanese: 昨年は災害が頻々とあった。
english: Last year, we had frequent disasters.

japanese: 昨年は我が家の庭で食べきれないほどのキャベツができた。
english: Our garden produced an abundance of cabbages last year.

japanese: 昨年は雨が多く米は不作だった。
english: We had a bad rice crop last year because it rained a lot.

japanese: 昨年は雨が多かった。
english: We had much rain last year.

japanese: 昨年は異常な冷夏で、稲作は１０年ぶりの凶作だった。
english: It was exceptionally cold last summer, and the rice crop was the worst in 10 years.

japanese: 昨年はモモがたくさん取れた。
english: There was a large harvest of peaches last year.

japanese: 昨年の物価上昇はまあまあだった。
english: There was a modest rise in prices last year.

japanese: 昨年の鉄鋼生産は推定億トンに達した。
english: Steel production reached an estimated 100 million tons last year.

japanese: 昨年の鉄鋼生産は１億トンに達したものとみられている。
english: Steel production is estimated to have reached 100 million tons last year.

japanese: 昨年の石炭生産高は水準に達しなかった。
english: Last year's output of coal fell short of the standard.

japanese: 昨年の所得の実質成長は５％だった。
english: Last year's growth of income was 5% after inflation.

japanese: 昨年の主な出来事は何でしたか。
english: What were the chief events of last year?

japanese: 昨年の今ごろは大雪だった。
english: We had a lot of snow about this time last year.

japanese: 昨年の夏、私たちは橋の上で花火を楽しく見た。
english: We enjoyed watching the fireworks on a bridge last summer.

japanese: 昨年のスカートは膝のすぐしたまでだった。
english: Skirts last year reached just below the knees.

japanese: 昨年のうちに、徹底的な健康診断をしてもらいましたか。
english: Have you had a thorough medical checkup within the last year?

japanese: 昨年に比べて今年は春の訪れが遅かった。
english: Spring has come later this year compared with last year.

japanese: 昨年に比べて今年は春の訪れが早かった。
english: Spring has come early this year compared with last year.

japanese: 昨年７月に日本の高校に通ったとき、私はこの目で見たことに感銘を受けました。
english: When I attended a Japanese high school last July, I was impressed with what I saw.

japanese: 昨日腕が痛かった。
english: I had an ache in my arm yesterday.

japanese: 昨日来るべきだったのに。
english: You should have come yesterday.

japanese: 昨日来なかった理由を言いなさい。
english: Tell me the reason you didn't come yesterday.

japanese: 昨日来た人がまたやってきた。
english: The same man that came yesterday is here again.

japanese: 昨日来た女の子は知らなかった。
english: The girl that came yesterday was a stranger to me.

japanese: 昨日友人と映画を見に行った。
english: We went to see a movie with my friend yesterday.

japanese: 昨日満枝さんが私のところに立ち寄った。
english: Mr Mitsue dropped in on me yesterday.

japanese: 昨日本を買った。
english: I bought a book yesterday.

japanese: 昨日母から手紙を受けとった。
english: I received a letter from my mother yesterday.

japanese: 昨日父が心臓発作を起こしたが、診療所が近くにあるのは好運だった。
english: My father had a heart attack yesterday, but he was lucky to have a clinic close at hand.

japanese: 私は昨日病院へ行きました。
english: I went to the hospital yesterday.

japanese: 昨日美容院へ行きました。
english: Yesterday I went to the hairdresser's.

japanese: 昨日飛行機で大阪に行きました。
english: I flew to Osaka yesterday.

japanese: 昨日悲しい出来事があった。
english: A sad accident took place yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼女は彼の言うことが聞こえないふりをした。
english: She made believe not to hear him yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼女は入学試験を受けた。
english: Yesterday she sat for the entrance examination.

japanese: 昨日彼女は荷造りを終えたので、今朝早く用意ができていた。
english: She packed yesterday, so as to be ready early today.

japanese: 昨日彼女は一日中家にいました。
english: She stayed at home all day long yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼女はパーティーで楽しんだ。
english: She enjoyed herself at the party yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼女から手紙をもらった。
english: I had a letter from her yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼らはテニスをしなかった。
english: They didn't play tennis yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼は彼女にあったかもしれない。
english: He may have met her yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼は遅く帰ってきた。
english: Yesterday he came back late.

japanese: 昨日彼は札幌行きの列車に乗り遅れた。
english: Yesterday he missed the train to Sapporo.

japanese: 昨日彼はとても長いスピーチをした。
english: He delivered a very long speech yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼はどこへ出かけましたか。
english: Where did he go yesterday?

japanese: 昨日彼の事務所を訪れた。
english: I called at his office yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼の事務所を訪ねた。
english: I called at his office yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼の家を訪れた。
english: I called at his house yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼のかばんが盗まれた。
english: His bag was stolen yesterday.

japanese: 昨日彼のお母さんに会ったら、彼は１週間前に退院したというのです。
english: When I saw his mother yesterday, she said he had left the hospital a week before.

japanese: 昨日彼に電話をかけましたか。
english: Did you call him up yesterday?

japanese: 昨日彼がぶらっと立ち寄った。
english: He dropped in on me yesterday.

japanese: 昨日買いました。
english: I bought it yesterday.

japanese: 昨日頭痛がひどかった。だから休んだのです。
english: I had a bad headache yesterday. That was why I was absent.

japanese: 昨日東京に着いた。
english: He arrived in Tokyo yesterday.

japanese: 昨日電話したとき、彼女が家にいてくれていたらな。
english: If only she had been home when I called yesterday!

japanese: 昨日田中さんという人が、あなたに会いにきましたよ。
english: A Mr. Tanaka came to see you yesterday.

japanese: 昨日天気が良かったら、私たちは動物園に行っただろう。
english: If the weather had been nice yesterday, we would have gone to the zoo.

japanese: 昨日通りで友人に会った。
english: I met my friend on the street.

japanese: 昨日通りでメアリーにあった。
english: Yesterday I met Mary on the street.

japanese: 昨日調べた単語の意味が思い出せないんだ。
english: I can't remember the meaning of the word that I looked up yesterday.

japanese: 昨日着ていたのと全く同じドレスを着ています。
english: She is wearing the same dress that she had on yesterday.

japanese: 昨日知らない人が、私に電話をかけてきた。
english: A stranger phoned me yesterday.

japanese: 昨日大統領が行った演説は支持者を喜ばせた。
english: The speech made by the president yesterday delighted his supporters.

japanese: 彼は昨日大酒を飲んだ。
english: He drank hard yesterday.

japanese: 昨夜大火事があった。
english: There was a big fire last night.

japanese: 昨日大きな迷路に入りました。
english: Yesterday we went into a huge maze.

japanese: 昨日台風が来ました。
english: We had a storm yesterday.

japanese: 昨日他の人たちと一緒にその試合に行っていたらなあ。
english: I wish I had gone with the others to the game yesterday.

japanese: 昨日窓を壊したのはトムだ。
english: It was Tom that broke the window yesterday.

japanese: 昨日洗濯物を外に干しっぱなしにしたら、朝にはカチンカチンに凍っていた。
english: I hung the laundry out to dry last night and by morning it had frozen hard as a rock.

japanese: 昨日切符を手に入れることができなかった。
english: I couldn't get the tickets yesterday.

japanese: 昨日数人の男の子が早退しなければならなかった。
english: Several boys had to leave school early yesterday.

japanese: 昨日水道を止められた。
english: The water was cut off yesterday.

japanese: 昨日新しい上着を手に入れた。
english: I got a new jacket yesterday.

japanese: 昨日新しいパソコンを買った。
english: I bought a new personal computer yesterday.

japanese: 昨日食べた魚がどうも当たったようだ。
english: The fish I ate yesterday did not agree with me.

japanese: 昨日食べたものがあたった。
english: Something I ate yesterday disagreed with me.

japanese: 昨日食べすぎた。
english: I ate too much food yesterday.

japanese: 昨日床屋で髪を切ってもらったんだ。
english: I had my hair cut at the barber shop yesterday.

japanese: 昨日叔父がたずねてきた。
english: My uncle dropped in on me yesterday.

japanese: 昨日手紙を出したのですか。それとも今日ですか。
english: Did you mail the letter yesterday or today?

japanese: 昨日私は夕立にあった。
english: Yesterday I was caught in a shower.

japanese: 昨日私は放送が二時間あった。
english: I was on the air for two hours yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私は彼に写真を撮ってもらった。
english: Yesterday, I had him take my photograph.

japanese: 昨日私は彼と電話で話した。
english: I talked with him over the telephone yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私は彼から食事に招かれた。
english: Yesterday, I was invited to dinner by him.

japanese: 昨日私は通りで旧友にあった。
english: I met an old friend on the street yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私は自転車を盗まれた。
english: Yesterday I had my bicycle stolen.

japanese: 昨日は仕事がなかったんだ。
english: I was free from work yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私は帰り道でにわか雨にあった。
english: Yesterday I was caught in a shower on my way home.

japanese: 昨日私はその手紙を投函した事を覚えている。
english: I remember posting the letter yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、本屋で昔の友達に会った。
english: I met an old friend of mine at a bookshop yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私は、ひどく泣いている男を見た。
english: Yesterday I saw a man who was crying bitterly.

japanese: 昨日私の留守中に見えたのは山田さんですか。
english: Was it Mr Yamada that came to see me during my absence yesterday?

japanese: 私の友人から辞書を借りた。
english: I borrowed the dictionary from my friend.

japanese: 昨日私の不在中に旧友が訪ねて来てくれた。
english: Yesterday, I had an old friend of mine call on me in my absence.

japanese: 昨日私の男性の友人が私を訪ねてきた。
english: A male friend of mine called on me yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私の旧友が訪ねてきた。
english: An old friend of mine visited yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私の身に起こったことを全部は話せない。
english: I cannot tell you everything that happened to me yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私たちは通りの雪かきをした。
english: We cleared the street of snow yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私たちは結婚１０周年のお祝いをした。
english: We celebrated our tenth wedding anniversary yesterday.

japanese: 昨日私たちが夕食を食べたレストランは、そんなによくはありません。
english: The restaurant where we had dinner yesterday isn't very good.

japanese: 昨日私がなくした鉛筆は古い物だった。
english: The pencil I lost yesterday was an old one.

japanese: 昨日無くしたペンは新しいのだったんだよ。
english: The pen which I lost yesterday was a new one.

japanese: 昨日高速道路でひどい事故があった。
english: Yesterday, there was a terrible accident on the highway.

japanese: 昨日公園には子供がいませんでした。
english: There weren't any children in the park yesterday.

japanese: 昨日雇い主が彼を解雇した。
english: His employer dismissed him yesterday.

japanese: 昨日故障したのは、私の車ではなくて彼の車だった。
english: It was his car, not mine, that broke down yesterday.

japanese: 昨日見たニュースに衝撃を受けた。
english: I was shocked by yesterday's news.

japanese: 昨日欠席した理由を言いなさい。
english: Give me the reason for which you were absent yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、警察がメアリーを訪ねた。
english: The police called on Mary yesterday.

japanese: 昨年兄は彼の友人の妹と結婚した。
english: My brother married his friend's sister last year.

japanese: 昨日、給料をもらったよ。
english: I got my pay yesterday.

japanese: 昨日強盗が店に押し入った。
english: A burglar broke into the shop yesterday.

japanese: 昨日休みを取ってピクニックにいきました。
english: I took a day off yesterday and went on a picnic.

japanese: 昨日は久しぶりに旧友に会った。
english: Yesterday I met an old friend of mine whom I had not seen for a long time.

japanese: 昨日起こった事について何とおっしゃいましたか。
english: What did you say in relation to what happened yesterday?

japanese: 昨日帰り道でにわか雨にあった。
english: Yesterday I was caught in a shower on my way home.

japanese: 昨日環境汚染に関する講義を受けました。
english: We had a lecture on environmental pollution.

japanese: 昨日学校を休んだ理由をいいなさい。
english: Tell me the reason for your absence from school yesterday.

japanese: 昨日学校をさぼったの？
english: You played hooky yesterday?

japanese: 昨日学校へ行けなかったのは病気だったからです。
english: It was because I was ill that I couldn't go to school yesterday.

japanese: 昨日会社からの帰宅の途中で、私は不良の一団に徹底的にたたきのめされてしまった。
english: I was beaten up by a gang of hoodlums on the way home from work.

japanese: 昨日会った人はまったくの紳士だった。
english: The man I saw yesterday was a complete gentleman.

japanese: 昨日家の近くで火事が起きた。
english: Yesterday a fire broke out near my house.

japanese: 昨日、家に帰る途中、夕立にあいました。
english: I was caught in a shower on my way home yesterday.

japanese: 昨日何ヶ月ぶりかに雨が降った。
english: It rained yesterday after it had been dry for many months.

japanese: 昨日何が起こったのか知らないのですか。
english: Don't you know what happened yesterday?

japanese: 昨日何があったのですか。
english: What happened to you yesterday?

japanese: 昨日駅で偶然彼に会った。
english: Yesterday I ran across him at the station.

japanese: 昨日駅で偶然彼にであった。
english: Yesterday I ran across him at the station.

japanese: 昨日英語の試験があった。
english: We had an examination in English yesterday.

japanese: 昨日映画館に行く予定でしたが、みんな疲れていたので、結局かわりに家で映画をみました。
english: We were planning to go to the cinema last night, but everyone was tired, so we ended up watching a movie at home instead.

japanese: 昨日映画を見に行ったら、偶然昔の友人に出会った。
english: I ran across an old friend when I went to the movies yesterday.

japanese: 昨日雨が降ったのはあいにくだった。
english: It was unfortunate that it rained yesterday.

japanese: 昨日一日中雨が降った。
english: It rained all day yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ロバートの所に遊びに行った、彼の父はパイロットです。
english: Yesterday I went to see Robert, whose father is a pilot.

japanese: 昨日ロジャース氏とスミス氏の婚約が発表された。
english: The engagement of Mr Rogers and Miss Smith was announced yesterday.

japanese: 昨日より今日の方が具合が悪い。
english: I feel worse today than I did yesterday.

japanese: 昨日より今日のほうがずっと気分が悪い。
english: I feel much worse today than yesterday.

japanese: 昨日より雲が多いな。
english: There's more cloud today than yesterday.

japanese: 昨日よいアイデアが浮かんだ。
english: Yesterday I hit on a good idea.

japanese: 昨日メアリーは表紙が青い本をくれた。
english: Yesterday Mary gave me a book the cover of which was blue.

japanese: 昨日メアリーは１日中家にいた。
english: Yesterday Mary stayed home all day.

japanese: 昨日メアリーが買ったのは何ですか。
english: What was it that Mary bought yesterday?

japanese: 昨日メアリーが買ったのはこのスカートだった。
english: It was this skirt that Mary bought yesterday.

japanese: 昨日みんなに笑われた。
english: Everyone laughed at me yesterday.

japanese: 昨日まで私はキャシーと話した事がなかった。
english: I had never talked with Cathy until yesterday.

japanese: 昨日まで一週間ずっと雨が降っていた。
english: It had been raining for week until yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ボブに何か起こったにちがいない。
english: Something must have happened to Bob yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は木曜日だった。
english: Yesterday was Thursday.

japanese: 昨日は無分別に買い物をしてしまった。
english: I bought a pig in a poke yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は夢をみなかった。
english: I didn't dream last night.

japanese: 昨日は僕の誕生日だった。
english: Yesterday was my birthday.

japanese: 昨日は風が強かっただけでなく雨も激しく降った。
english: Not only were there strong winds yesterday, but also it rained heavily.

japanese: 昨日は病気だったけど、今日は元気になれそうです。
english: I was ill yesterday but I am feeling fine today!

japanese: 昨日は彼女は外出しないで家にいた。
english: Yesterday she stayed at home instead of going out.

japanese: 昨日は彼の家に泊まった。
english: I stayed at his place yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は彼の容体はたいへん危なかったが、今日はだいぶんよい。
english: Yesterday he was seriously ill, but today he is much better.

japanese: 昨日は日曜日でした。
english: It was Sunday yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は日曜日で、土曜日ではなかった。
english: Yesterday was Sunday, not Saturday.

japanese: 昨日は曇っていた。
english: It was cloudy yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は天候が悪かった。
english: The weather was very bad yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は天気が悪かった。
english: We had bad weather yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は大雪だったんだよ。
english: It snowed hard yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は大変に寒かったので帽子をかぶった。
english: I wore a hat yesterday because it was very cold.

japanese: 昨日は大雨だった。
english: We had a heavy rain yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は素晴らしい夕食にご招待してもらって、ありがとう。
english: Thank you very much for the wonderful dinner last night.

japanese: 昨日は全く風がありませんでした。
english: There was no wind at all yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は全くついていなかった。
english: It just was not my day yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は雪がひどかった。
english: It snowed hard yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は暑くも寒くもなくて、散歩には打ってつけの日であった。
english: Yesterday it was neither too warm nor too cold. It was an ideal day for taking a walk.

japanese: 昨日は暑かった。
english: It was hot yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は私は日記にたくさん書きました。
english: I wrote a lot in my diary yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は私の十七歳の誕生日だった。
english: Yesterday was my seventeenth birthday.

japanese: 昨日は今日より寒かった。
english: It was colder yesterday than today.

japanese: 昨日は君がいないので寂しかった。
english: I missed you very much yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は強い風が吹いた。
english: A strong wind blew yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は久しぶりにひまだったので、友人とテニスを楽しんだ。
english: As I was free after a long interval yesterday, I enjoyed playing tennis with my friends.

japanese: 昨日は気温が零下５度に下がった。
english: The temperature fell five degrees centigrade below zero yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は寒かったが、今日は更にいっそう寒い。
english: It was cold yesterday, but it is still colder today.

japanese: 昨日は寒かったですか。
english: Was it cold yesterday?

japanese: 昨日は寒かった。
english: It was cold yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は楽しかったかい？
english: Did you have a good time yesterday?

japanese: 昨日は楽しかったか、と私は彼に尋ねた。
english: I asked him if he had enjoyed himself the day before.

japanese: 昨日は楽しかった。
english: I had a good time yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は何人が動物園へ来ましたか。
english: How many people came to the zoo yesterday?

japanese: 昨日は雨が降ったが、今朝は晴れた。
english: It rained yesterday, but it cleared up this morning.

japanese: 昨日は一日中懸命に働いた。
english: I worked hard all day long yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は一日中英単語を暗記した。
english: I learned English words by heart all day yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は一日中雨が降っていた。
english: It rained all day yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はよい天気だった。
english: We had nice weather yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はよく眠れましたか？
english: Did you have a good night last night?

japanese: 昨日は一日中雨が降ったりやんだりしていた。
english: It was raining off and on all day yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はなんともひどい天気だった。
english: The weather was miserable yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はとても忙しかったんだ。
english: I was very busy yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はとても風が強かった。
english: It was very windy yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はとても寒かったので私は家にいた。
english: It was so cold yesterday that I stayed home.

japanese: 昨日はとても寒かった。
english: It was terribly cold yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はテニスをしましたか。
english: Did you play tennis yesterday?

japanese: 昨日はテレビを見る時間がなかった。
english: I didn't have time to watch TV yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はその本を８０ページ読んだ。
english: Yesterday, I read 80 pages of that book.

japanese: 昨日はでかけないで読書で日を過ごした。
english: I spent yesterday reading instead of going out.

japanese: 昨日はその本を８０ページまで読んだ。
english: I read the book up to page 80 yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はじめてその事故について聞きました。
english: I heard about the accident for the first time yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はグデングデンに酔っ払っちゃって、どうやって家に帰ったのか覚えてないんだ。
english: I got blind drunk last night - so drunk I don't even know how I got home.

japanese: 昨日はかなりたくさんの人々がその会合に参加した。
english: Quite a few people came to the meeting yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はあまりにも気分が悪くて学校に行けなかった。
english: I was too sick to go to school yesterday.

japanese: 昨日はあまり寒くなかった。
english: It was not very cold yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は４発命中しただけでした。
english: I only shot four bull's-eyes yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は１日中忙しかったので、今朝はひどく疲れている。
english: Having been busy all day yesterday, I feel very tired this morning.

japanese: 昨日は一日中寝ていた。
english: I slept all day yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は１日中雨だったので、私は家にいました。
english: It rained all day long yesterday, so I stayed home.

japanese: 昨日は、誰か君を訪問しましたか。
english: Did anybody call on you yesterday?

japanese: 昨日は、私のコンピューターが故障していたのです。
english: My computer was down yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は激しく雨が降った。
english: It rained hard yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は、何もする事が無かったので、一日中家でゴロゴロしていた。
english: Yesterday I didn't have anything to do so I was just lolling around all day long.

japanese: 昨日は曇りだった。
english: It was cloudy yesterday.

japanese: 昨日の嵐で建物は被害を受けた。
english: The buildings were damaged by the storm last night.

japanese: 昨日の夜僕たちはとても疲れていたので９時頃寝た。
english: We were so tired that we turned in about 9:00 last night.

japanese: 昨夜は近所で火事があって、眠れませんでした。
english: Last night there was a fire near here, and I couldn't sleep.

japanese: 昨日の夜どこにいたの？
english: Where were you last night?

japanese: 昨日の夜、特別試写会があった。
english: There was a special sneak preview last night.

japanese: 昨日の夜、遅くまでインターネットしていたの。
english: I surfed the net late last night.

japanese: 昨日の夢は今日の希望。
english: The dream of yesterday is the hope of today.

japanese: 昨日の晩、私のショーを聞いてくれた？
english: Did you hear my show last night?

japanese: 昨日の晩は楽しかったです。
english: I had a good time last evening.

japanese: 昨日の敵が今日の友になることもある。
english: An enemy yesterday can be a friend today.

japanese: 昨日の朝はとても寒かった。
english: It was very cold yesterday morning.

japanese: 昨日の朝たくさんの鳥を見た。
english: Yesterday morning I saw many birds.

japanese: 昨日の朝、激しく雨が降った。
english: It rained hard yesterday morning.

japanese: 昨日の朝、あなたはテニスをしていましたか。
english: Were you playing tennis yesterday morning?

japanese: 昨日の戦闘でだいぶ被害があったようだ。
english: It seems that much damage was done by yesterday's battle.

japanese: 今日の新聞によれば、昨夜この町に火事があったそうだ。
english: According to today's paper, there was a fire in this town last night.

japanese: 昨日の重役会は大成功だった。
english: Yesterday's board meeting was a ten-strike!

japanese: 昨日の主な出来事は何でしたか。
english: What were yesterday's chief events?

japanese: 昨日の試合で早稲田は慶応と引き分けた。
english: Waseda tied Keio in yesterday's game.

japanese: 昨日の試験の問題は思ったよりずっとやさしかった。
english: The questions in yesterday's examination were far easier than I had expected.

japanese: 昨日の仕事を片づけるつもりです。
english: I will clean up yesterday's work.

japanese: 昨日の阪神巨人戦を見たかい。
english: Did you see the game yesterday between the Hanshin Tigers and the Tokyo Giants?

japanese: 昨日の今頃は何をしていましたか。
english: What were you doing about this time yesterday?

japanese: 昨日の午後誰を訪ねましたか。
english: Whom did you visit yesterday afternoon?

japanese: 昨日の午後はずっと、私の部屋を掃除するのに費やした。
english: I spent all yesterday afternoon cleaning my room.

japanese: 昨日の競馬のメインレースは、とってもかたくおさまったよ。ああいうのを、銀行レースって言うんだよね。
english: The main race yesterday was no surprise. That's the kind of race you can bank on.

japanese: 昨日の議論には参加しましたか。
english: Did you take part in the discussion yesterday?

japanese: 昨日の株式市場の出来高は５億株だった。
english: Yesterday's turnover on the stock market was 500 million shares.

japanese: 昨日の株価下落に伴い、今日の取引は低迷だった。
english: Trading was slow today after yesterday's market decline.

japanese: 昨日の会議にはすべての委員が出席したわけではなかった。
english: All the members were not present at the meeting yesterday.

japanese: 昨日は小雨だった。
english: There was a light rain yesterday.

japanese: 昨日のバーバラの運転免許の試験はどうでしたか。
english: How did Barbara do on her driver's test yesterday?

japanese: 昨日のパーティーの間、彼女は時折家に電話していた。
english: Every now and then she called home during the party last night.

japanese: 昨日のパーティーにくればよかったのに。
english: We missed you very much at the party yesterday.

japanese: 今日のテストは去年のと同じだった、と誰かが言った。
english: Somebody told me that today's test was identical to the one we had last year.

japanese: 昨日のテストはうまくいったかもしれないが、まだその結果はわからない。
english: I might have done well on yesterday's test, but I do not know the results yet.

japanese: 昨日のコンサートにはたくさんの聴衆がいた。
english: There was a large audience at yesterday's concert.

japanese: 昨日のけんかを気にしてるの？意外にナイーブなのね。
english: Are you still letting last night's fight bother you? That's so naive.

japanese: 昨日のあなたの講演はとてもすばらしかった。
english: The lecture you gave yesterday was a masterpiece.

japanese: 昨日の１０時、外には何百人もの人がいた。
english: At 10 o'clock yesterday, there were hundreds of people outside.

japanese: 昨日になって初めてわれわれはその動物がいなくなっているのに気づいた。
english: It was not until yesterday that we noticed the animal missing.

japanese: 昨日になって初めてその事実を知った。
english: It was not until yesterday that I knew the fact.

japanese: 昨日になってはじめてその事故のことを聞きました。
english: It was not until yesterday that I heard about the accident.

japanese: 昨日になって初めてそのニュースを知りました。
english: It was not until yesterday that I knew the news.

japanese: 昨日になってようやく真相を知りました。
english: Not until yesterday did I know the truth.

japanese: 昨日になってやっとその事実を知りました。
english: Only yesterday did I know the fact.

japanese: 昨日になってやっと、彼女が本当に言いたいことが分かった。
english: It was only yesterday that I realized what she really meant.

japanese: 昨日になってはじめて僕は彼女の名前を知った。
english: It was not until yesterday that I knew her name.

japanese: 昨日になってはじめて私はその知らせをきいた。
english: It wasn't until yesterday that I heard the news.

japanese: 昨日になってはじめて私はそのことを知った。
english: Not until yesterday did I know about it.

japanese: 昨日になって初めてそのことに気づいた。
english: It was not until yesterday that I noticed it.

japanese: 昨日になってはじめて、私はその出来事を知った。
english: Not until yesterday did I know of the event.

japanese: 昨日になってはじめて、あなたの手紙を受け取った。
english: We did not get your letter until yesterday.

japanese: 昨日トラックがこの塀にぶつかった。
english: Yesterday a truck hit this wall.

japanese: 昨日トムはバイクの事故でけがをしたので、しばらく体育の授業には出られません。
english: Yesterday, Tom was injured in a motorbike accident, so he can't attend gym class for the time being.

japanese: 昨日テレビで面白い番組を見た。
english: We saw an interesting program on television yesterday.

japanese: 昨日デパートに買い物に行きました。
english: I went to the department store to do some shopping yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ディズニーランドへ行きました。
english: I went to Disneyland yesterday.

japanese: 昨日チケットを手に入れたんだ。
english: I got tickets yesterday.

japanese: 昨日たくさん日記を読みました。
english: I read a lot in my diary yesterday.

japanese: 昨日たくさんの雨が降った。
english: We had a lot of rain yesterday.

japanese: 昨日その答えを知ってさえいたらなあ。
english: If only I had known the answer yesterday!

japanese: 昨日その窓をこわしたのはジャックです。
english: It was Jack that broke the window yesterday.

japanese: 昨日その手紙を書いておけばよかったのだが。
english: I ought to have written the letter yesterday.

japanese: 昨日その仕事を仕上げる予定だったのだができなかった。
english: I was to have finished the work yesterday.

japanese: 昨日その絵を買ったのは誰だろう。
english: Who was it that bought those pictures yesterday?

japanese: 昨日その家に泥棒が入った。
english: Yesterday, a thief entered the house.

japanese: 昨日その家に雷が落ちた。
english: The house was struck by lightning yesterday.

japanese: 昨日そこへ行った学生はだれもいない。
english: No students went there yesterday.

japanese: 昨日そこへ行ったのは私です。
english: It's me that went there yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ジョーンズ氏のために送別会が開かれた。
english: A farewell party was held in honor of Mr Jones yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ジョーンズ氏のために歓迎会が開かれた。
english: A welcome party was held in honor of Mr Jones.

japanese: 昨日ジャイアンツはライオンズに勝った。
english: The Giants beat the Lions yesterday.

japanese: 昨日コンサートに行ったのはアリスだった。
english: It was Alice who went to the concert yesterday.

japanese: 昨日この横断歩道で、１人の歩行者がトラックにひかれた。
english: Yesterday a pedestrian was run over by a truck at this pedestrian crossing.

japanese: 昨日このラケットを買ったのはマイクでした。
english: It was Mike that bought this racket yesterday.

japanese: 昨日このスカートを買ったのは誰ですか。
english: Who was it that bought this skirt yesterday?

japanese: 昨日このスカートを買ったのはメアリーだった。
english: It was Mary that bought this skirt yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ここに来た女性は山田さんだ。
english: The woman who came here yesterday is Miss Yamada.

japanese: 昨日ここに来たと彼は言った。
english: He told me he came here yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ここに着いた運転手を見つけに行きなさい。
english: Go and find the driver who arrived here yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ここで雅子にあったのは私でした。
english: It was I who met Masako here yesterday.

japanese: 昨日ケンに会った。
english: I met Ken yesterday.

japanese: 昨日から何も食べてない。
english: I haven't eaten anything since yesterday.

japanese: 昨日からずっと寒い。
english: It has been cold since yesterday.

japanese: 昨日から雨が降っている。
english: It has rained since yesterday.

japanese: 昨日からずっと雨が降っている。
english: It has been raining since yesterday.

japanese: 昨日お訪ねくださったとき、あいにく留守をしていた。
english: It happened that I was out when you called yesterday.

japanese: 昨日お金を貸しませんでしたか。
english: Didn't I lend you some money yesterday?

japanese: 昨日エンジンが故障してね。
english: I had some engine trouble yesterday.

japanese: 昨日おいで下さったそうですが、あいにく不在で失礼しました。
english: I am sorry to learn you called at my home yesterday while I was out.

japanese: 昨日インドで大きな地震が起こった。
english: A big earthquake occurred in India yesterday.

japanese: 昨日いくつの卵を手に入れたか。
english: How many eggs could you get yesterday?

japanese: 昨日いい考えを思いついたんです。
english: Yesterday I hit on a good idea.

japanese: 昨日ある料理店で偶然彼女に会った。
english: I met her by chance at a restaurant yesterday.

japanese: 昨日アメリカから来た学生に会った。
english: I met a student from America yesterday.

japanese: 昨日あまり寝る時間がなかったので、会社に来てから一日中うつらうつらしていた。
english: I didn't get much sleep last night so I was nodding off all day at work.

japanese: 昨日あの会社の株価が暴落した。
english: That company's stock price fell yesterday.

japanese: 昨日あなたをお訪ねするつもりだったのですが。
english: I had intended to visit you yesterday.

japanese: 昨日あなたはテニスをしていた。
english: You played tennis yesterday.

japanese: 昨日あなたの手紙をポストに入れたことを覚えています。
english: I remember posting your letter yesterday.

japanese: 昨日２学期が終わった。
english: The second term came to an end yesterday.

japanese: 昨日１台の車がその崖から落ちた。
english: Yesterday a car fell over the cliff.

japanese: 昨日、有給休暇を取りました。
english: I took a paid day off yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、母とセールに出かけて、服をおねだりした。
english: I went to a sale with my mother yesterday and kept hounding her to buy me a dress.

japanese: 昨日、彼女は病気で寝ていた。
english: She was sick in bed yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、彼女は偶然ジャックに会った。
english: She came across Jack yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、彼女は１０時間以上寝た。
english: She slept more than ten hours yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、彼女の家を探すのにちょっとばかり手間取った。
english: I had some trouble finding her house yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、彼は彼女に車の運転方法を尋ねた。
english: He asked her how to drive a car yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、彼は基地に帰らなかった。
english: He didn't come back to the base yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、東京は曇りでしたか。
english: Was it cloudy in Tokyo yesterday?

japanese: 昨日、誰かが彼女を訪ねてきた。
english: Someone called on her yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、窓を壊したのは誰ですか。
english: Who was it that broke the window yesterday?

japanese: 昨日、叔父に会ったら、３日前にロンドンからかえったところだと言っていた。
english: When I saw my uncle yesterday, he told me that he had returned from London three days before.

japanese: 昨日、私は買い物をしている間に自転車を盗まれた。
english: Yesterday my bicycle was stolen while I was doing some shopping.

japanese: 昨日、私は道を歩いていて事故をみかけた。
english: Yesterday, as I was walking along the street, I saw an accident.

japanese: 昨日、私は叔父の家を訪問した。
english: I called at my uncle's house yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、私は時計を調べてもらうためにその店に行った。
english: Yesterday I went to the store to get my watch checked.

japanese: 昨日、私は空港で有名な学者に会った。
english: I met a famous scholar at the airport yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、私は学校から帰る途中にわか雨にあった。
english: As I returned from school yesterday, I was caught in a sudden shower.

japanese: 昨日、私は駅で彼女に偶然出会った。
english: Yesterday I ran across her at the station.

japanese: 昨日、私はエレンに手紙を出した。
english: Yesterday I wrote to Ellen.

japanese: 昨日、仕事をしたのですか。
english: Did you work yesterday?

japanese: 昨日、胸にするどい痛みをおぼえた。
english: I had a sharp pain in my chest yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、会社帰りに昔の彼女にバッタリ会った。
english: Yesterday I was on my way home from work when I ran smack into my old girlfriend.

japanese: 昨日、加古川で真一に会った。
english: I saw Shinichi in Kakogawa yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、バットがボールといっしょに盗まれた。
english: The bat was stolen yesterday, along with the balls.

japanese: 昨日、ジャイアンツぼろ負け！！
english: The Giants got clobbered yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、アンプを組み立てた。
english: I built an amplifier yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、このあたりで船が沈んだ。
english: A ship sank near here yesterday.

japanese: 昨日、アメリカから帰ってきたので、まだ頭の中が英語環境だ。
english: I just got back from the States yesterday, so I'm still thinking in English.

japanese: 昨秋は晴天続きだった。
english: We had a spell of fine weather last autumn.

japanese: 昨今は災害が頻ぴんとあった。
english: Recently we have had several disasters.

japanese: 昨今、物価は非常に高い。
english: Nowadays prices of commodities are very high.

japanese: 昨今、個人的自由は少なくなっている。
english: Personal liberty is diminishing nowadays.

japanese: 作文を書くのに大切なことは、自分の考えをはっきりさせることである。
english: What is important in writing a composition is to make your ideas clear.

japanese: 作文は書いてしまいましたか。
english: Have you finished writing your composition?

japanese: 作物は枯れた。
english: The crops have withered.

japanese: 作物は厳しい寒さにやられた。
english: The crop was blasted by the severe cold.

japanese: 作物の出来不出来は試合中の選手達のボールの投げ方やけり方によって決まるものと信じられていたのです。
english: It was believed that the success of their crops depended on the way the players threw or kicked the ball during the game.

japanese: 作物には本当に雨が必要だと最近新聞で読んだ。
english: I read in the newspaper recently that the crops really need rain.

japanese: 作動温度が高いと、潤滑剤の寿命は短くなる。
english: High operating temperatures shorten lubricant life.

japanese: 作者は恋人に対する情熱を表現している。
english: The author expresses his passion for his love.

japanese: 作者の真の意志を知るためには行間を読まなければならない。
english: You have to read between the lines to know the true intention of the author.

japanese: 作曲家は音楽を作る。
english: Composers create music.

japanese: 作曲家の中では誰が一番好きですか。
english: Which of the composers do you like best?

japanese: 作曲をするには創造力に富んでいなければならない。
english: You must be creative in composing a piece of music.

japanese: 作業員は新しい家に配線工事をしている。
english: The workers are wiring the new house.

japanese: 作業員が岩を爆破しているのを見た。
english: We saw laborers blasting rocks.

japanese: 作業をする人は髪を短くきらなければなりません。
english: Workers must have their hair cut short.

japanese: 作家は必ずしも人生をあるがままに描くとは限らない。
english: The writer does not always present life as it is.

japanese: 作家は誰でも自分に合った書き方をする。
english: Every writer writes in the way that accords with his own idiosyncrasies.

japanese: 作家は自分達の想像力を頼りにして書く。
english: Writers draw on their imagination.

japanese: 作家はよく辞書を参照する。
english: Writers often refer to a dictionary.

japanese: 作家としての彼女は伝統的なカテゴリーのいずれにも当てはまらない。
english: As a writer, she does not fit into any of the traditional categories.

japanese: 作家としては尊敬するが嫌いだ。
english: Much as I admire him as a writer, I don't like him as a man.

japanese: 作るのは難しかったですか。
english: Was it difficult to make?

japanese: 埼玉と千葉の間に川があります。
english: There is a river between Saitama and Chiba.

japanese: 榊さんとかいう方がお見えになりました。
english: A Mr Sakaki has come to see you.

japanese: 阪神大震災では地面が長時間に渡って揺れた。
english: In the Hanshin earthquake, the ground shook for a long time.

japanese: 阪神三日天下。あっと言う間に首位から転落しちゃったよ。
english: Hanshin's moment of glory didn't last. They fell out of first place in a hurry.

japanese: 坂本さんこれからもいい仕事を続けてください。
english: Keep up the good work, Mr. Sakamoto.

japanese: 坂崎幸之助はアルフィーに所属しています。
english: Kounosuke Sakazaki belongs to "THE ALFEE".

japanese: 財務的な事柄に関して、ジョーンズ氏は会社の誰よりも知っている。
english: With respect to financial matters, Mr Jones knows more than anyone else in the company.

japanese: 財布を無くさないでね。
english: Don't lose your purse.

japanese: 財布を探すのを手伝ってくれませんか。
english: Will you help me look for my purse?

japanese: 財布を手探りしたがなくなっていた。
english: When I felt for my pocketbook I found it was gone.

japanese: 財布を家に忘れてきたので１０００円貸してくれないかと彼は私に言った。
english: He said that he had left his purse at home and asked me if I could lend him 1,000 yen.

japanese: 財布を家に忘れてきたことをふと思い出した。
english: It occurred to me that I had left my purse at home.

japanese: 財布を握っている者が家の支配者である。
english: Who holds the purse, rules the house.

japanese: 財布をヒータの上に置くな。
english: Don't put the wallet on the top of the heater.

japanese: 財布をなくしたので、父はその日１日中不機嫌だった。
english: All that day my father was out of humor because he had lost his wallet.

japanese: 財布をどこかこの辺に落としたんだ。
english: I lost my wallet somewhere around here.

japanese: 財布をしまっておきなさい。
english: Put away your wallet.

japanese: 財布をさがしているのですが。
english: I'm looking for a wallet.

japanese: 財布をあらためて見たら中は空だった。
english: I examined the purse again, and found it empty.

japanese: 財布の紐を締めなくてはいけない。
english: We have to be careful with expenses.

japanese: 財布の中身をこの袋に空けなさい。
english: Empty the purse into this bag.

japanese: 財布に金が無くなった。
english: I have no more money in my wallet.

japanese: 財布にはお金が少しも残っていなかった。
english: There was no money left in my wallet.

japanese: 財布にお金をいれた。
english: I put my money in a purse.

japanese: 財布とパスポートがなくなってます。
english: My wallet and passport are missing.

japanese: 財布が重ければ心は軽くなる。
english: A heavy purse makes a light heart.

japanese: 財政不安の結果、金の価格が急騰しています。
english: Gold prices are skyrocketing in the wake of financial instability.

japanese: 財政的援助が彼らに与えられている。
english: Financial support is given to them.

japanese: 財政赤字の埋め合わせの一般的方法は債券発行です。
english: A common way to finance a budget deficit is to issue bonds.

japanese: 財政赤字の削減が政府の大きな関心事である。
english: Reducing the budget deficit is a major concern of the government.

japanese: 財政状態は週ごとに悪化している。
english: The financial situation is getting worse week by week.

japanese: 財政危機に直面している発展途上国もある。
english: Some developing countries are faced with financial crises.

japanese: 財政改革は今の財政難を改善するかもしれません。
english: Financial reforms may ameliorate the current economic difficulties.

japanese: 財政の専門家たちは最近の動向をどう判断してよいのかわからないのです。
english: Financial experts don't know what to make of this trend.

japanese: 財産目当てに結婚するものは自由を売り渡すものである。
english: He that marries for wealth sells his liberty.

japanese: 財産分与が争いの種だった。
english: The division of the property was a bone of contention between the brothers.

japanese: 財産を相続する。
english: I succeed to a fortune.

japanese: 財を成すため、彼は地位を利用した。
english: He exploited his position to build up his fortune.

japanese: 財産をそんなに見せびらかす物ではない。
english: Don't make such a parade of your wealth.

japanese: 財産は父から息子へと譲られた。
english: The property passed from father to son.

japanese: 財産は相続人たちの間で平等に分けられた。
english: The property was divided equally among the heirs.

japanese: 財産は３人兄弟の間で分配された。
english: The fortune was divided among the three brothers.

japanese: 財産と人格とはまったく別のものだ。
english: What we have is one thing and what we are is quite another.

japanese: 罪人は考えを変えるよう彼に懇願した。
english: The criminal pleaded with him to change his mind.

japanese: 罪人は絞首台に送られた。
english: The criminal was sent to the gallows.

japanese: 罪を犯したなら、罰せられなければならない。
english: If you commit a crime, you must be punished.

japanese: 罪の報いは死である。
english: The wages of sin is death.

japanese: サラリーマンが罪ほろぼしに僻地でひっそりと暮らしはじめた。
english: The salaryman went to live quietly in a remote area in order to atone for his sins.

japanese: 罪の意識が彼の顔にはっきり現れている。
english: The guilt manifests itself on his face.

japanese: 罪に比例して罰するべきだ。
english: The punishment should be in proportion to the crime.

japanese: 材質は何ですか。
english: What's the material?

japanese: 在庫がなくなりははじめている。
english: The supplies are beginning to give out.

japanese: 際どかった。
english: That was a close shave.

japanese: 際どいところを辛うじて助かった。
english: I had a close shave.

japanese: 裁判長は被告に大いに同情していた。
english: The presiding judge was touched by pity for the accused.

japanese: 裁判長は被告に死刑の判決を言い渡した。
english: The presiding judge sentenced the defendant to death.

japanese: 裁判長は、２時間の休憩を告げた。
english: The judge called for a recess of two hours.

japanese: 裁判所は彼女に罰金を支払うように命じた。
english: The court decreed that she should pay the fine.

japanese: 裁判所は彼が無罪であると判決を下した。
english: The court adjudged him not guilty.

japanese: 裁判所はその料金を支払うように命じた。
english: The court decreed that the charge be paid.

japanese: 裁判所はその弁護士に証拠の提出を求めた。
english: The court called on the lawyer to give evidence.

japanese: 裁判所が未成年の犯罪者に対してとる姿勢は成人の犯罪者に対する姿勢とは異なる。
english: The attitude of the court toward young criminals is different from its attitude toward adult criminals.

japanese: 裁判所が法律を執行する。
english: The courts administer the law.

japanese: 裁判官は傍聴人に静寂にするように命じた。
english: The judge charged the audience to be silent.

japanese: 裁判官は非常にすばやくその訴訟を片づけた。
english: The judge disposed of the case in short order.

japanese: 裁判官は彼に罰金を言い渡した。
english: The judge sentenced him to a fine.

japanese: 裁判官は彼に重い罰金を科せるのだろうか。
english: Will the judge fine him heavily?

japanese: 裁判官は彼に死刑を宣告した。
english: The judge condemned him to death.

japanese: 裁判官は彼に五年の懲役刑を宣告した。
english: The judge sentenced him to a jail term of five years.

japanese: 裁判官は思わず笑った。
english: The judge laughed in spite of himself.

japanese: 裁判官は原告に不利な判決を下した。
english: The judge decided against the plaintiff.

japanese: 裁判官はついうっかり笑ってしまった。
english: The judge laughed in spite of himself.

japanese: 裁判官はその未決囚の行動に対する嫌悪の念をためらうことなくあからさまにして、できるだけ過酷な刑を下した。
english: The judge made no bones about his disgust with the accused's actions and handed down the severest sentence possible.

japanese: 裁判官はその囚人の一年の刑期を赦免した。
english: The judge pardoned the prisoner a year of his sentence.

japanese: 裁判官はその囚人が有罪であると決断を下した。
english: The judge concluded that the prisoner was guilty.

japanese: 裁判官は、それが初犯であることを考慮に入れた。
english: The judge took into consideration the fact that it was his first offense.

japanese: 裁判官は、その囚人が無罪だと結論をくだした。
english: The judge concluded that the prisoner was innocent.

japanese: ヤッパリさんが裁判官に慈悲を求めて訴えた。
english: Mr. Yappari appealed to the judge for mercy.

japanese: 裁判官には慎重さがなくてはならない。
english: Discretion is proper to judges.

japanese: 裁判官が有罪の判決を下した以上、いさぎよく服役しなければならない。
english: The judge pronounced him "guilty", and now he must face the music of a sentence in prison.

japanese: 裁判を中断するのは不可能だ。
english: Suspending the trial is out of the question.

japanese: 裁判は三時間続いた。
english: The court session lasted for three hours.

japanese: 裁判は公明正大であることが要求される。
english: Judgment requires impartiality.

japanese: 裁判はこちらの負けにおわりそうだ。
english: The lawsuit is likely to end in our defeat.

japanese: 裁判は１０日間継続して行われた。
english: The trial lasted for ten consecutive days.

japanese: 裁判で決着をつけましょう。
english: Let's take it to court.

japanese: 菜食主義者へのおすすめは、なんですか。
english: Can you recommend any vegetarian dishes?

japanese: ベジタリアン用の特別メニューはありますか？
english: Do you have a special menu for vegetarians?

japanese: 細部まで気を配りなさい。
english: Remember to cross your t's.

japanese: 細縄で鞭を作った。
english: They made a whip out of cords.

japanese: ムリエルさんはバイトで細細と暮らしている。
english: Muriel is living poorly off of her part-time job.

japanese: 細菌は小さすぎて我々の眼には見えない。
english: Germs are too tiny for our eyes to see.

japanese: 細菌は顕微鏡の力を借りて初めて見られる。
english: Germs can only be seen with the aid of a microscope.

japanese: 細菌が病気を引き起こすことがある。
english: Germs can cause sickness.

japanese: 細かなほこりが空中に浮いている。
english: Particles of dust float in the atmosphere.

japanese: 細かい所は省いて構わない。
english: You may leave out the details.

japanese: 細かい雨が降っていた。
english: A fine rain was falling.

japanese: 細かいところは後で決めましょう。
english: Let's arrange the details later.

japanese: 細かいことに気をつける人は、ものを書く時にｉに点をつけ、ｔに横棒をつけることを忘れないだろう。
english: He who minds his Ps and Qs will not forget to dot the "i's" and cross his "t's", when writing.

japanese: 細かいことにこだわるな。
english: Don't split hairs.

japanese: 細かいことでとやかく言うのはよそう。
english: Let's not quibble over trivial matters.

japanese: 斎藤さんを覚えていますか。
english: Do you remember Mr Saito?

japanese: 祭日が日曜にダブると月曜が休みになる。
english: When a holiday falls on Sunday, we have an extra holiday on Monday.

japanese: 祭が終わった。
english: The festival came to an end.

japanese: 砦は不意に攻撃された。
english: The fort was attacked by surprise.

japanese: 災害が相次いでその地域を襲った。
english: A string of disasters struck the region.

japanese: 災い転じて福となる。
english: Good comes out of evil.

japanese: 災い転じて福となせ。
english: Make the best of a bad bargain.

japanese: 災いを転じて福としなさい。
english: Turn your misfortune to account.

japanese: 済んでしまったことをああだこうだ言ってもどうにもならないだろう。
english: You can critique it all you want and it won't change a thing. It's over.

japanese: 済んだら戻してください。
english: Bring it back when you are through.

japanese: 済んだことは気にするな。
english: Don't worry about what you've done.

japanese: 済みません。通してくれますか。
english: Excuse me. Can I get by here?

japanese: 歳入は増えているが経費の増加には追いつかない。
english: Revenues are growing, but not as fast as costs.

japanese: 歳月は人を待たず。
english: Time and tide wait for no man.

japanese: 歳月は距離同様二重の魅力を添える。
english: Age, like distance, lends a double charm.

japanese: 歳月はいつのまにか過ぎ去っていった。
english: The year stole by.

japanese: 栽培に適した土壌を得るには耕さなければならない。
english: In order to get the soil ready for planting you must plow it.

japanese: 採用と決定したらご通知いたします。
english: If we decide to hire you, you will hear from us.

japanese: 採点しましたか。
english: Did you mark the papers?

japanese: 採掘場が爆発した時、中には誰もいなかった。
english: There was no one in the mine when it blew up.

japanese: 才無しは財無しより、もっと始末が悪い。
english: Want of wit is worse than want of gear.

japanese: 才能を隠しているだけなんだよ。
english: She just hides her light under a bushel.

japanese: 才能は訓練を必要とする。
english: One's talent is in need of discipline.

japanese: 才能がなくても諦めてはいけない。
english: You shouldn't give up just because you have no talent.

japanese: 才能ある者を抑えておくことはできない。
english: You can't keep a good man down.

japanese: 才色兼備だ。
english: She is as wise as fair.

japanese: 才子多病、佳人薄命。
english: Whom the gods love die young.

japanese: 鳩山さんが競馬で妻子を養っていると言っています。
english: Hatoyama says that he supports his family by gambling on horse racing.

japanese: 妻子は運命に与えられた人質である。
english: Wife and children are hostages given to fortune.

japanese: 妻を待たせていたので私は駅へ急いだ。
english: I hurried to the station as I had kept my wife waiting.

japanese: 妻を説得して新しい車を買うのをやめさせた。
english: I talked my wife out of buying a new car.

japanese: 妻を元気付けようとして、トムは美しい真珠のネックレスを買ってやった。
english: Hoping to cheer up his wife, Tom bought her a beautiful pearl necklace.

japanese: 妻への贈り物を探しているんです。
english: I'm looking for a gift for my wife.

japanese: 妻は旅行に連れていって欲しいと言った。
english: My wife suggested to me that I take her on the trip.

japanese: 妻は養子をとりたかった。
english: My wife wanted to adopt a child.

japanese: 妻は毎日の決まりきった仕事に飽きつつある。
english: My wife is getting tired of the daily routine.

japanese: 妻は風邪を引きやすい。
english: My wife is liable to catch a cold.

japanese: 妻は部屋のむこう端から私に合図した。
english: My wife gave me a sign from across the room.

japanese: 妻は夫より長生きするものだ。
english: Wives usually outlive husbands.

japanese: 妻は夫から独立して財産を所有しうる。
english: A wife can have property independent of her husband.

japanese: 妻は彼のためにお風呂を用意した。
english: His wife ran a hot bath for him.

japanese: 妻は二日間の旅行に出かけた。
english: My wife went on a two-day trip.

japanese: 妻はひとつ目の猫を見て震え上がった。
english: My wife shuddered at the sight of a one-eyed cat.

japanese: 妻は世間知らずです。
english: My wife is ignorant of the world.

japanese: 妻は新しい家を買うかどうかじっくりと検討した。
english: My wife deliberated whether we would buy a new house or not.

japanese: 妻は食品を買いに毎日村のマーケットに出かける。
english: My wife goes to the village market to buy foods every day.

japanese: 妻は私を説き伏せて新車を買わせようとした。
english: My wife tried to persuade me into buying a new car.

japanese: 妻は私を説き伏せて新車を買わせた。
english: My wife talked me into buying a new car.

japanese: 妻は私の母とうまくやっている。
english: My wife gets on well with my mother.

japanese: 妻は今、肺炎にかかっています。
english: My wife is suffering from pneumonia.

japanese: 妻は結婚後５ポンド体重が増えた。
english: After getting married, my wife put on five pounds.

japanese: 妻は驚いたように見えた。
english: My wife looked surprised.

japanese: 妻は気分に支配されやすい。
english: My wife is subject to moods.

japanese: 妻は癌で死んだ。
english: My wife died of cancer.

japanese: 妻は外食をするのが好きなので、料理をする必要がない。
english: My wife likes to eat out and so she doesn't have to cook.

japanese: 妻は外食が好きで、だから食事を作る必要がないのです。
english: My wife likes to eat out and so she doesn't have to cook.

japanese: 妻は家を買いたい欲求に取りつかれている。
english: My wife is possessed with the desire to buy a house.

japanese: 妻は以前は家にいましたが、今は働いています。
english: My wife used to stay home, but she works now.

japanese: 妻は以前にその町にいたことを思い出した。
english: My wife remembered having been in the town before.

japanese: 妻はやりくりが上手だ。
english: My wife is a good manager.

japanese: 妻はまるで私が町一番のお金持ちであるかのようにお金を使う。
english: My wife spends money as if I were the richest man in town.

japanese: 妻はパートタイムで働いている。
english: My wife works part time.

japanese: 妻はふだん、夜はコーヒーを飲みません。私もそうです。
english: My wife usually doesn't drink coffee at night, and neither do I.

japanese: 妻はちょうど食卓を片付けたところだ。
english: My wife has just cleared the table.

japanese: 妻はいつも愚痴ばかりこぼしている。
english: My wife is always complaining about something.

japanese: 妻はアメリカでの新しい生活のリズムに慣れるのにえらい苦労した。
english: My wife had a hard time getting into the swing of our new life in America.

japanese: 妻の誕生日を忘れてから彼女が僕に冷たくてね。
english: My wife has had it in for me since I forgot her birthday.

japanese: 妻の死の知らせを聞いてもまゆ一つ動かさなかった。
english: He did not even raise an eyebrow at the news of his wife's death.

japanese: 妻の思いがけない死は、５０年以上にわたる、幸福な夫婦生活に終止符をうった。
english: The untimely death of my wife has brought down the curtain on over 50 years of happily married life.

japanese: 妻の金がなければ、彼は決して重役にはなれないだろう。
english: Without his wife's money, he would never be a director.

japanese: 妻の活動は家事に限られている。
english: A wife's activities are confined to domestic matters.

japanese: 妻のひっきりなしの愚痴話には本当にいらいらする。
english: My wife's constant nagging really gets on my nerves.

japanese: 妻に逃げられてから彼は酒を飲むようになった。
english: He took to drinking after his wife left him.

japanese: 妻に贈るバッグをさがしているんですが。
english: I'm looking for a bag for my wife.

japanese: 妻に四六時中ぶつぶつ言われるのには憂鬱になってしまう。
english: My wife's constant nagging is getting me down.

japanese: 妻に欠点はある。でもやはり私は彼女を愛している。
english: My wife has faults. None the less, I love her.

japanese: 妻と私はときどき好んで中華料理を食べに行く。
english: My wife and I like to go out for Chinese food once in a while.

japanese: 妻と私はしょっちゅう口論する。
english: I constantly quarrel with my wife.

japanese: 妻と子供たちは私に頼っている。
english: My wife and children depend on me.

japanese: ジムさんは時々、妻といさかいをする。
english: Jim sometimes has disagreements with his wife.

japanese: 妻が来るまで駅で待とうと決心した。
english: I decided to wait at the station until my wife came.

japanese: 妻が服を着終わるまでには、バスは出てしまっていた。
english: The bus had left by the time my wife finished dressing.

japanese: 妻が電話してきたら、私は重要な会議中で出られないと言ってください。
english: If my wife calls, just tell her I'm in an important meeting and cannot be disturbed.

japanese: 妻が堕落するのは夫が悪いのだ。
english: It is their husbands' faults if wives do fall.

japanese: 妻が寝た後、書斎で仕事をした。
english: I worked in my study after my wife had gone to bed.

japanese: 妻が死んだ男の人は男やもめと呼ばれます。
english: A man whose wife is dead is called a widower.

japanese: 妻が家計簿をつけています。
english: My wife keeps the household accounts.

japanese: 妻が家を留守にしたので、彼は一人で夕食を作った。
english: His wife being out, he cooked dinner for himself.

japanese: 妻がいないと何かと不自由だ。
english: I am inconvenienced when my wife is away.

japanese: 妻がいなかったら、彼は仕事をかえはしなかっただろうに。
english: If it had not been for his wife, he would not have changed his job.

japanese: 最良の材料のみを使用するよう十分な注意を払っております。
english: Great care has been taken to use only the finest ingredients.

japanese: 最低賃金はこのところほとんど変わっていません。
english: The minimum wage has hardly budged as of late.

japanese: 最低価格と一番早い納期を見積もってくださるようお願いいたします。
english: Please estimate your best price and the earliest delivery date.

japanese: 最低１時間前にはカウンターへいらっしゃってください。
english: Please come to the counter at least an hour before your flight.

japanese: 最大限度に働いている。
english: I am working with full steam.

japanese: 最大限の努力をすればあとで後悔しないから。
english: Give it your all, and you won't be sorry later.

japanese: 原子力事故に対して最大限の努力を尽くしております。
english: We are making all efforts possible to deal with the nuclear crisis.

japanese: 最大限の努力をしなさい。
english: Mark your maximum efforts.

japanese: 最大の注意を払って運転しなさい。
english: Drive with the utmost care.

japanese: 最大の幸せは自由の中にある。
english: The greatest happiness lies in freedom.

japanese: 最大の英語の辞書には４５万語以上のっている。
english: The largest English dictionary has over 450,000 words.

japanese: 最大２００語以内に。
english: Maximum length: 200 words.

japanese: 最善を尽くすつもりだ。
english: I will do my best.

japanese: 最善を尽くすなら、成功するでしょう。
english: If you do your best, you will succeed.

japanese: 最善を尽くしますが、よくいっても木曜以前に終える事は出来ません。
english: I'll do my best, but I'll not be able to finish it before Thursday at best.

japanese: 最善を尽くしなさい。そうすれば成功するでしょう。
english: Do your best, and you will succeed.

japanese: 最善を尽くしていたら、私は成功したかもしれなかった。
english: Had I done my best, I might have succeeded.

japanese: 最善を期待しよう。
english: Let's hope for the best.

japanese: 最善をつくせば、誰も君をとがめないでしょう。
english: If you do your best, no one will blame you.

japanese: 最善をつくすつもりです。
english: I will do my best.

japanese: 最善をつくすことはよいことである。
english: It is good to do your best.

japanese: 最善と思われる処置を取りなさい。
english: Take such steps as you think best.

japanese: 最前列の席は有りますか。
english: Can I have a seat in the stalls?

japanese: 最前列で絵を描いている女の子は私の姪です。
english: The girl drawing a picture in the first row is my niece.

japanese: 最新の流行を追うのは大変お金がかかる。
english: It is very expensive to keep up with the latest fashions.

japanese: 最新のメールの保存場所を間違ってしまったようです。
english: It seems I have misplaced your last mail.

japanese: 最新のニュースは何ですか。
english: What is the latest news?

japanese: 最新のカタログを送りください。
english: Please send me your latest catalogue.

japanese: 最上級生は週末にも図書館への入場許可がある。
english: Senior students have access to the library at weekends.

japanese: 最上階にレストランがある。
english: There is a restaurant on the top floor.

japanese: 最上のワインはフランスのものです。
english: The finest wines are those from France.

japanese: 最上のものは後から出てくる。
english: The best is behind.

japanese: 最小限度の世話で、立派に育つ植物もある。
english: Some plants grow well with a minimum of care.

japanese: 最初読んだ時私は君のレポートの間違いを見落としていた。
english: I overlooked the mistakes in your paper the first time I read it.

japanese: 最初私は彼を先生だと思っていたが、そうではなかった。
english: At first, I thought he was a teacher, but he wasn't.

japanese: 最初私は彼が言っていることが理解できなかった。
english: At first, I couldn't make out what he was saying.

japanese: 最初に何をすればよいかわからなかった。
english: I didn't know what to do first.

japanese: 最初私はどちらが欲しいのかわからなかったが、後になってこの赤いほうに決めた。
english: At first I was not sure which one I wanted, but afterwards I decided on this red one.

japanese: 最初私はギターをひくことができなかった。
english: At first, I couldn't play the guitar.

japanese: 最初簡単に思えるものが、あとで難しいとわかることがよくある。
english: What seems easy at first often turns out to be difficult.

japanese: 最初メグは、家が恋しかった。
english: At first, Meg was homesick.

japanese: 最初は彼は恥ずかしそうにしていた。
english: He was shy at first.

japanese: 彼は彼女を最初は好きではなかった。
english: He didn't like her at first.

japanese: 最初は彼の言っていることが分からなかった。
english: At first, I couldn't make out what he was saying.

japanese: 最初は彼のことを信じなかった。
english: I didn't believe him at first.

japanese: 最初は彼のことが好きではなかったけれど今は好きです。
english: At first I didn't like him, but I do now.

japanese: 最初は彼が誰だか分からなかった。
english: I didn't recognize him at first.

japanese: 最初は彼が誰かわからなかった。
english: I didn't recognize him at first.

japanese: 最初は彼がよそよそしいように見えた。
english: He looked unfriendly at first.

japanese: 最初は誰も私を信じなかった。
english: No one believed me at first.

japanese: 最初は誰も私の言うことを信じなかった。
english: No one believed me at first.

japanese: 最初は全てのことを手帳に書き留めようとしました。
english: At first I tried to write everything down in my notebook.

japanese: 最初は小さな灰色の家々を通って走っていきました。
english: At first they drove through streets of small, gray houses.

japanese: 最初は私は彼が言っていることを理解できませんでした。
english: At first, I couldn't understand what he said.

japanese: 最初は私は何をしてよいかわからなかった。
english: At first, I didn't know what to do.

japanese: 最初は私は新しい環境に対処するのは難しいと思った。
english: Initially I found it difficult to deal with my new environment.

japanese: 最初は簡単に思えることがあとで難しいと分かることがよくある。
english: What seems easy at first often turns out to be difficult.

japanese: 最初はやさしく思われるものが、実際は難しいことがよくある。
english: What seems easy at first often turns out to be difficult.

japanese: 最初はみんな、彼の無実を確信していた。
english: At first everybody was convinced of his innocence.

japanese: 最初はバレエは好きではなかったが、しだいに好きになっていった。
english: At first I didn't like ballet, but I've come to like it by degrees.

japanese: 最初の電気計算器は１９世紀末に出現した。
english: The first electric calculator came into existence toward the end of the 19th century.

japanese: 最初は、多くのことが異なっていたように思われましたが、すぐに新しい生活にとけ込めました。
english: At first many things seemed different, but I soon got involved in my new life.

japanese: 最初の打者はアウトになった。
english: The first batter was caught out.

japanese: 最初の通りを右に曲がりなさい。
english: Take the first street to the right.

japanese: 最初の赤ん坊が生まれたとき、彼らはすでに結婚して１０年になっていた。
english: When they had their first baby, they had been married for 10 years.

japanese: 最初の信号を左へ曲がるのですか。
english: Do I turn left at the first stoplight?

japanese: 最初の信号を左へ曲がって下さい。
english: Turn left at the first light.

japanese: 最初の条項には何と書いてあるか。
english: How does the first article run?

japanese: 最初の手紙の後二通目からの手紙はすぐにきた。
english: After the first letter the other came easily.

japanese: 最初の攻撃は目標を外れた。
english: The first attack missed the target.

japanese: 最初の原子爆弾は日本に落とされた。
english: The first atomic bomb was dropped on Japan.

japanese: ２０１１年の最初の月の利益も１００万円を越えました。
english: The revenues for the first month of 2011 exceed one million yen.

japanese: 最初の計画ではこの道路はすでに完成しているはずだ。
english: This road should have already been completed according to the original plan.

japanese: 最初の議題は、教育委員会によって提出された動議です。
english: The first item is a motion proposed by the Education Committee.

japanese: 最初の角を左に曲がってください。
english: Please turn left at the first corner.

japanese: 最初の角を右の曲がりなさい。
english: Turn at the first corner to the right.

japanese: 最初の角を右に曲がってまっすぐに行きなさい。
english: Take the first turn to right and then go straight on.

japanese: 最初の印刷機はグーテンベルグによって発明された。
english: The first printing machine was invented by Gutenberg.

japanese: 最初の一歩が常に最も難しい。
english: The first step is always the hardest.

japanese: 最初のパラグラフでは、いわゆるサプライサイドの経済戦略というものの妥当性について疑問を呈する。
english: In the opening paragraphs I query the validity of so-called supply-side economic strategies.
